pli-tv-bu-vb-sk62:0.2: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk62:1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk62:1.2: At that time the monks from the group of six gave teachings to people wearing sandals. …
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk62:1.3.1: “‘I will not give a teaching to anyone wearing sandals who is not sick,’ this is how you should train.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk62:1.4: One should not give a teaching to anyone wearing sandals who is not sick.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk62:1.5: If a monk, out of disrespect, gives a teaching to someone who is not sick and who is standing on sandals, whose sandals are fastened, or whose sandals are loose, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk62:1.8: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk62:1.9: The second training rule is finished.
